intro: Benthamia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate benthamia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are often pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Benthamia rostrata is a short-lived perennial, often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soil.
